key_channel_insights.line_content: OTAs offered lower fares on 37.6% of itineraries last week versus only 22.1% priced higher, signaling a clear discount bias in the channel.
MSE listings undercut website fares in 77.1% of itineraries last week, though discount share dipped by 1.6pp week-over-week.
GDS fares were higher than website prices on 67.17% of routes last week, marking a significant premium bias.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Last week the OTA channel priced lower on 37.6% of itineraries versus 22.1% priced higher, signaling a clear discount bias.
22.14% of OTA fares exceeded website prices last week, up 0.94pp week-over-week with an average premium of 0.19%.
Offers missing on OTA fell to 13.79% of itineraries, down 1.13pp month-over-month indicating stronger inventory presence.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 13.79% of itineraries were unavailable on OTA last week, improving by 1.13pp month-over-month.
Exact fare matches held at 26.46% of itineraries, remaining flat month-over-month with a slight 0.09pp uptick.
22.14% of fares were higher on OTA last week, up 0.68pp month-over-month, averaging a 0.19% markup.
37.62% of fares were lower on OTA last week, up 0.37pp month-over-month, delivering a 0.04% average discount.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: OTA priced lower on 46.80% of short-haul routes, up 0.07pp week-over-week with an average 0.04% price reduction.
Long-haul routes saw missing OTA offers at 60.83%, while premiums climbed to 19.88% with a 0.05% average markup.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: In the Netherlands, OTA fares were lower on 74.59% of routes, up 0.23pp week-over-week with a 0.03% average discount.
Non-NL markets had 43.54% of fares priced higher on OTA, up 1.38pp week-over-week yielding a 0.19% average premium.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: OTA priced lower on 36.44% of close-in bookings, up 0.36pp week-over-week with a 0.03% average discount.
21.71% of far-out bookings were priced higher on OTA, up 0.22pp week-over-week delivering a 0.22% average markup.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE listings undercut website prices in 77.1% of itineraries last week, delivering an average 0.06% advantage despite a 1.6pp dip.
Fares matched website prices on 10.3% of itineraries, up 2.4pp week-over-week and marking the highest parity in four weeks.
Missing offers on MSE declined to 12.4% of itineraries, down 0.9pp week-over-week and 1.2pp month-over-month.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Instances where website offers were absent on MSE fell to 12.4%, improving by 0.9pp week-over-week and 1.2pp month-over-month.
Same-price listings grew to 10.3% of itineraries, up 2.4pp week-over-week and 3.0pp month-over-month.
Discounted listings remain dominant at 77.1%, only modestly down by 1.6pp week-over-week.
Higher-priced listings were negligible at 0.23% of itineraries, mostly flat month-over-month.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes show a 90.8% discount share on MSE, averaging a 0.06% fare gap despite a 2.7pp week-over-week dip.
60.4% of long-haul itineraries were missing on MSE, down 2.1pp week-over-week, as parity availability rose to 18.3%.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: NL markets delivered discounts on 84.9% of MSE listings, up 0.6pp week-over-week, reducing missing offers to 12.3%.
Non-NL origins saw parity listings climb to 18.0%, up 4.2pp, while discount share moderated to 69.3%.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in itineraries undercut direct fares in 76.4% of cases, down 1.7pp week-over-week, as parity listings rose to 10.7%.
Far-out bookings held a 78.4% discount share, down 1.3pp, with parity listings increasing to 9.6%.

gds_highlights.line_content: 67.17% of GDS itineraries were priced above website levels last week, up 1.79pp month-over-month.
Only 0.06% of GDS fares undercut the website last week, remaining effectively flat.
The average GDS-to-website price gap held at +0.11%, consistent with prior weeks.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: GDS fares exceeded website prices on 67.17% of routes, unchanged week-over-week and up 1.79pp month-over-month.
20.44% of itineraries matched website fares, up 1.19pp week-over-week despite a slight 0.55pp monthly decline.
GDS undercut the website in just 0.06% of cases, down marginally from 0.12% last week.
Routes not found on GDS fell to 12.32%, decreasing by 1.13pp week-over-week and 1.24pp month-over-month.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 78.76% of short-haul itineraries carried higher GDS fares, down 0.85pp week-over-week with a +0.12% average gap.
60.65% of long-haul routes were unavailable on GDS, down 1.81pp, while 20.12% had premiums at a +0.05% gap.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 54.28% of GDS fares from the Netherlands were priced higher, up 1.12pp week-over-week with a +0.05% average markup.
81.00% of non-NL itineraries showed higher GDS pricing, down 1.36pp week-over-week with a +0.16% average gap.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 60.37% of close-in bookings carried higher GDS fares, down 0.63pp week-over-week with a +0.12% premium.
80.31% of far-out itineraries were priced higher on GDS, up 1.46pp week-over-week at a +0.10% average gap.
